html: In a twin Song of Salvation, the remnant of Jehovah’s people that returns from exile (Isaiah 11:10-16) praises Jehovah at his marvelous deliverance. Just as the fame of Israel’s God spread among the nations when he delivered his people from bondage in Egypt and brought them to the Promised Land (Joshua 9:9), so his fame spreads among the peoples who didn’t participate in the exodus to Zion but who survive Jehovah’s Day of Judgment: “O Jehovah, you are my God; I will extol you by praising your name. For with perfect faithfulness you have performed wonders, things planned of old” (Isaiah 25:1).
